numbered_ace_sentences: 1. The graph is dated January 31, 2024.
2. I notice systemic barriers.
3. These systemic barriers keep rich people able to obtain a good education.
4. A legacy boost during college admissions is a systemic barrier.
5. A legacy boost is used especially at top selective universities.
6. I think that the graph is appalling.
7. I think that these systemic barriers keep less-fortunate people less fortunate.
8. I think that these systemic barriers make rich people richer.
9. Generational wealth exists.
10. Nepotism exists.
11. I wonder why these colleges still implement legacy boosts during the college admissions process.
12. I wonder what benefit these universities get by preferring legacy students.
13. Affirmative action exists.
14. I wonder how a legacy boost and affirmative action reduce the chance of middle-class students to attend an elite university.
15. I reside in a rural area.
16. I have peers.
17. I think that I and my peers are likely unable to attend an elite university because of legacy boosts in admissions.
18. Many legacy students attend wealthy private schools.
19. I think that I and my peers might not have resources that are required by admissions criteria at elite universities.
20. Wealthy private schools might have these resources readily available.
21. The headline is: Systemic barriers captivating colleges: Legacies leading admission.
